activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Barry Joe Lucas Sr.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:25 AM Defendant Barry Joe Lucas in court by video. Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Victim S.T. appeared in court by audio. Defendant states he is going to file petition for appointment of counsel and enters a not guilty plea, remand to branch 7 for scheduling. Court amends part of bond condition: Defendant to have no physical contact with victim S.T. but may have written or telephonic contact, all other previous conditions remain. Defendant to sign bond at courthouse today per his request and Court approval.

Activity: Initial appearance

3:27 PM Defendant Barry Joe Lucas in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney C. James Fitzgerald by video. David S Olson and Intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety. No acts or threats of violence.  No contact directly or indirectly with victim S.T., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except for one time trip with law enforcement to retrieve necessities. May have 3rd party contact for purposes of child care. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10AM.
